title: 111_hr2141
content: The "Interagency Council on Homelessness Reform Act of 2009" aims to coordinate the Federal response to homelessness and create a national partnership to reduce and end homelessness. SEC. 3. MEMBERS. Amends the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act to include key government officials as members. SEC. 4. MEETINGS. Changes the frequency of meetings and the rotation of leadership positions. SEC. 5. EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. SEC. 5. EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. The President appoints an Executive Director with Senate approval, serving at the President's pleasure. The Executive Director reports to the Director of Domestic Policy Council. Section 203 of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to develop a national plan to end homelessness for all Americans within 12 months of the enactment of the Interagency Council on Homelessness Reform Act of 2009. The plan must be updated every 2 years. The amendment to Section 203 of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act includes developing alternatives to criminalizing homelessness and eliminating laws that target homeless individuals for basic activities in public spaces. The Interagency Council on Homelessness Reform Act of 2009 evaluates the federal role in coordinating with state and local entities to address homelessness, makes recommendations for Congress to reduce homelessness, and develops methods to improve coordination between the Council and existing federal agencies dealing with homelessness. The Reform Act of 2009 aims to minimize the period of homelessness and requires the Council to prepare biennial reports on their efforts to address homelessness, which must be made publicly available. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to authorize appropriations of $3,000,000 for fiscal year 2009 and necessary sums for fiscal years 2010 through 2015. Amounts appropriated shall remain available until expended.
